thread.title: Man shoves handfuls of live bees down his shirt | New York Post
thread.title_full: Man shoves handfuls of live bees down his shirt | New York Post

title: Man shoves handfuls of live bees down his shirt | New York Post
text: 0:31 Man shoves handfuls of live bees down his shirt In order to prove his patience and self-control, an unidentified Indian man allowed himself to be filmed shoving live bees down his shirt. He literally grabs handfuls of bees from a hive and forces hundreds, if not thousands, of the insects down his shirt. 0:56 Dirtbags beat up Bronx deliveryman while bystanders watch Ahmed Sayed, a 21-year-old Chinese food deliveryman, was attacked and robbed in the lobby of a building in the Bronx. Perhaps the most shocking part of the video, however, is all of the bystanders who are standing around nearby and doing nothing to help. 1:17 Racist jerk is forced to pay for his tirade While riding on a train from London to Glasgow, 47-year-old Alexander Mackinnon allegedly yelled at another passenger's child and then hurled racist insults at the mother. She filmed him as he continued to insult her while talking on the phone, before he was removed from the train by police and fined. 1:18 This woman suffers from a disease that makes her smell like fish Kelly Fidoe-White got complaints about her odor her entire life, to the point where she would take multiple showers a day. In 2015, she was diagnosed with trimethylaminuria, a condition that prevents her body from breaking down certain compounds in foods, which are then expelled from the body through sweat, breath and urine, which causes a fish- or onion-like odor. 0:58 The Syrian government wanted her dead but this young girl survived Rescue workers saved a young girl trapped under the debris after an airstrike in Syria. The attack destroyed three rebel-held neighborhoods outside Damascus, killing at least seven people. The heroes who found the girl are part of Syria Civil Defense, a volunteer organization also known as the White Helmets. 1:03 This hoverbike is almost as cool as a jetpack The Scorpion-3, a prototype of a so-called "hoverbike," went on a test run in a warehouse in San Francisco. The electric vehicle was developed by the Russian tech company Hoversurf using quadcopter drone technology. 0:58 Incredible rescue of snowboarder buried alive for 10 minutes Mac Jacobson thought he was done for when he fell off a cliff while snowboarding and landed head-first in the snow. Unable to free himself, Jacobson had to wait in silence and hope that rescue was on the way, which it fortunately was. 0:43 Californians gave this weather phenomenon a dirty name After record amounts of rainfall in California, water has begun flowing into the Lake Berryessa spillway, making it look as if a giant drain has appeared in the middle of the lake. While the spillway is officially called the Morning Glory Spillway, locals refer to it as the Glory Hole. 1:03 Brave girl was born with heart outside chest Virsaviya Borun, a 7 year-old girl from Russia, is suffering from a rare heart condition known as Pantalogy of Cantrell. She has traveled to the United States with her mother in the hopes of receiving a life-saving operation. Supporters are following their incredible story on Instagram , as well as donating funds to help their family. 1:03 Your backyard fire pit sucks compared to this dude’s fire tornado Popular stuntman Colin Furze constructed a unique firework launcher to celebrate his YouTube channel reaching 4 million subscribers. The contraption uses a cylindrical metal cage and a motorized spinner to create a so-called “fire tornado.”
